snippet: Lt. Gov. Mark Darr said Friday that he would leave office on Feb. 1, giving in to pressure from Democrats and fellow Republicans who said his impeachment was inevitable over ethics violations tied to his campaign and office spending.
abstract: Arkansas Lt Gov Mark Darr, facing threat of impeachment proceedings after a settlement with state's Ethics Commission for misusing campaign money, says he will resign.
lead_paragraph: Lt. Gov. Mark Darr said Friday that he would leave office on Feb. 1, giving in to pressure from Democrats and fellow Republicans who said his impeachment was inevitable over ethics violations tied to his campaign and office spending.

headline.main: Arkansas: Lieutenant Governor Quitting Under Pressure
headline.print_headline: Arkansas: Lieutenant Governor Quitting Under Pressure
